name: TCP ACK Firewall Scanner
author: kris katterjohn <katterjohn@gmail.com>
description:
Map out firewall rulesets with a raw ACK scan.  Any
        unfiltered ports found means a stateful firewall is
        not in place for them.

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SNAPLEN
options.description: The number of bytes to capture

options.name: TIMEOUT
options.description: The reply read timeout in milliseconds

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST
options.description: Send a TTL=1 random UDP datagram to this host to discover the default gateway's MAC

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_PORT
options.description: The port on GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST to send a random UDP probe to (random if 0 or unset)

options.name: THREADS
options.description: The number of concurrent threads (max one per host)

options.name: ShowProgress
options.description: Display progress messages during a scan

options.name: ShowProgressPercent
options.description: The interval in percent that progress should be shown

options.name: BATCHSIZE
options.description: The number of hosts to scan per set

options.name: DELAY
options.description: The delay between connections, per thread, in milliseconds

options.name: JITTER
options.description: The delay jitter factor (maximum value by which to +/- DELAY) in milliseconds.
